arm_group.arm_group_label: Interrogation with unpaired remote monitoring transmitter
arm_group.description: Interrogation with an unpaired remote monitoring transmitter for devices that are compatible.
Interrogation with programmer according to usual standard of care

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective, post market, non-randomized study to evaluate the reduction in time to
      interrogation for patients with St. Jude Medical remote care compatible devices interrogated
      by the unpaired Merlin@home transmitter in the Emergency Department (ED).  Two sites will
      enroll up to 100 patients total.

      Expected duration of the study is 6 months.  Once enrolled the patient will participate in
      the study for the duration of the Emergency Department stay, until discharged or admitted to
      the hospital.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remote Device Interrogation In The Emergency Department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Present to Emergency Department with an implanted pacemaker or defibrillator.

          2. Are 18 years of age or older, or of legal age to give informed consent specific to
             state law.

          3. Are willing and able to provide informed consent for study participation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None

intervention.arm_group_label: Interrogation with unpaired remote monitoring transmitter

facility.name: Los Angeles Biomedical Research Institute at Harbor - UCLA

clinical_study.official_title: Remote Device Interrogation In The Emergency Department

other_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the Emergency Department Check In Time until the Emergency Department Check Out Time (discharged/leaves Emergency Department or admitted to hospital).

overall_official.affiliation: Los Angeles Biomedical Research Institute at Harbor - UCLA

primary_outcome.description: Time to interrogation is defined as the time from Triage (decision to interrogate the device) until the first of: Completion of interrogation, Time of Clinical/Treatment decision, or Emergency Department check out time.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the Emergency Department Check In Time until the first of:  Time of Clinical/Treatment Decision or Emergency Department Check Out Time (discharged/leaves Emergency Department or admitted to hospital).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
